Text:
For someone as musically diverse as I, saying with any certainty what band, artist or group can be called a "favorite" is very difficult. That being said, I have no trouble designating this band as my true favorite.

They have such a lovely sense of melody, and a more-than adequate level of playskill to pull of their densely packed, mile-a-minute compositions I couldn't help but fall in love (even years ago when I so naively admonished this style of singing).

That certainly doesn't mean they're perfect. I know a quite a few bands that have more talented musicians, better studio work or more clever lyrics (Daath, Slipknot, Between the Buried and Me, Dethklok, etc), but none of them get anywhere near pure, unfiltered awesome-in-a-bottle this band can crank out. I mean, what other death/black/whatever metal band do you know that can write songs that play out so aggressively, yet stir up deep feelings of hope and joy? Even with the inevitable decline in quality (almost) every band faces sooner or later, they manage to keep their head above water and remain far ahead of most of their peers.

...Oh, but Come Clarity WAS awful. I'd actually recommend not even downloading it, since whoever produced it was obviously going deaf (Terrible overcompression, 'smileyface' EQ, no clear attempts to separate any one element in the mix, the tom-toms seemed to have more bass than the kick drum, and '...bassist? What bassist?') and Anders tried whining his way through some pretty lame lyrics rather than growling or trying to sing in, well, ANY key... A stain on their track record, for sure.
Thank you for the download! My favorite band for years. PLZ SEED
